title: Pattern 1: Two Pointers
excerpt: Stop solving random problems. Learn how to use two pointers to reduce time complexity from O(n²) to O(n).

title: Two Sum II (Sorted)
excerpt: Given a sorted array, find two numbers that add up to a target using O(1) space.

title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
excerpt: Given a sorted array, remove duplicates in-place and return the count of unique elements using O(1) space.

title: Squares of a Sorted Array
excerpt: Given a sorted array, return a new array of squares in sorted order using the Two Pointers technique.

title: Sort Colors (Dutch National Flag Problem)
excerpt: Given an array with values 0, 1, and 2, sort the array in-place using the Three Pointer (Dutch National Flag) approach without using any sorting function.

title: 3Sum
excerpt: Given an array of integers, find all unique triplets that sum to zero using sorting and the Two Pointers technique to achieve O(n²) time complexity.

title: 4Sum
excerpt: Given an array of integers and a target, find all unique quadruplets that sum to the target using sorting and the Two Pointers based K-Sum approach with O(n³) time complexity.

title: Sliding Window Pattern
excerpt: Sliding Window is a technique used to efficiently process subarrays or substrings by maintaining a moving window over contiguous elements, reducing time complexity from O(n²) to O(n).

title: Max Sum Subarray of Size K
excerpt: Given an array and an integer k, find the maximum sum of any contiguous subarray of size k using the Sliding Window technique with O(n) time complexity.

title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum
excerpt: Given a target and an array of positive integers, find the smallest contiguous subarray whose sum is at least the target using a dynamic Sliding Window approach in O(n) time.

title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
excerpt: Given a string, find the length of the longest contiguous substring without repeating characters using a dynamic Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Fruit Into Baskets
excerpt: Given an array representing types of fruits, find the length of the longest contiguous subarray containing at most two distinct types using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Longest Repeating Character Replacement
excerpt: Given a string and an integer k, find the length of the longest substring that can be obtained by replacing at most k characters using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.
